TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit IISIntrinsicsAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Enables access to ASP intrinsic values from <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ContextUtil.GetNamedProperty%2A?displayProperty=fullName>. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ASP intrinsic objects can be obtained within a COM+ object using the named properties available from the COM+ object context when the object was created from ASP. With ASP.NET, a new set of intrinsic objects is used, which are not accessed from a context but rather methods in a namespace, much like the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ContextUtil> class. The case of COM+ objects created from ASP.NET is viable; therefore the intrinsic objects available to COM objects from the COM+ object context might be required so that the COM+ object can interact with ASP.NET.
For more information about using attributes, see [Attributes](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, enabling access to the ASP intrinsic values.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(bool val) cil managed

Docs.param: to enable access to the ASP intrinsic values; otherwise, .
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, optionally disabling access to the ASP intrinsic values.
Gets a value that indicates whether access to the ASP intrinsic values is enabled.
Docs.value: if access is enabled; otherwise, . The default is .
